StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Multi Omic Microbiome Study: Pregnancy Initiative (MOMS-PI)

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The dataset(s) used for the analyses described in this manuscript were obtained from the database of Genotype and Phenotype (dbGaP) found at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap through dbGaP [accession number phsxxxxxx]. Samples and associated data for the dataset “Multi Omic Microbiome Study: Pregnancy Initiative [MOMS-PI]” were provided by Gregory A. Buck, Ph.D. and colleagues. This work was supported by a cooperative agreement from the NICHD, NIH [U54 HD080784] to the Virginia Commonwealth University [P.I. Gregory A. Buck, Ph.D.]
Policy.ic_specific_access_term:
The use of the MOMS-PI dataset requires local IRB approval. All requestors and data users must provide a local Institutional Review Board (IRB) letter from their respective institution approving conduct of the proposed research project. Only full or expedited approvals will be accepted.
Use of the MOMS-PI dataset also requires dissemination of the results of your study to the scientific community by means of publication.
This dataset may be used for methods development research [e.g. development of software or algorithms].
The requestor should be aware that additional, highly sensitive data is being maintained in a data center at The Virginia Commonwealth University. When use of the MOMS-PI dataset has been approved by dbGaP, the requestor may be interested in this additional, restricted-use data collected through MOMS-PI. If so, please contact the MOMS-PI program directly at moms@vcu.edu or gregory.buck@vcuhealth.org for more information on applying for a restricted-use data contract. More information on the MOMS-PI initiative and the Vaginal Microbiome Consortium can be obtained at www.vmc.vcu.edu/momspi and www.vmc.vcu.edu, respectively.
The annual progress report should cite work done that relates specifically to the MOMS-PI dataset and not just a generic report for a series of datasets that may also have been requested at the same time.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Pregnancy Complications, IRB, PUB, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-PREG-COM-IRB-PUB-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Pregnancy Complications. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
